scripts.precompress:extension: npm run lint && npm run test:app && npm run build:extension && npm run test:chrome && npm run test:electron
scripts.precompress:firefox: npm run lint && npm run build:firefox && npm run test:app
scripts.test: npm run test:app && npm run build:extension && npm run test:chrome && npm run test:electron

releases.name: v2.13.2
releases.body:
- Support for Vivaldi browser.
- Deprecate using the Redux Extension inside other extensions in favour of [Remote Redux DevTools](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remote-redux-devtools).

releases.name: v2.13.1
releases.body: Revert stringifying Symbols out of the box as not being reliable in case of constructors.

releases.name: Extended API and helper package to use in production
Full support for ImmutableJS out of the box
Big update of Redux DevTools monitors
releases.body:
### Time travelling by just jumping to a specific action ([#60](https://github.com/alexkuz/redux-devtools-inspector/pull/60))
- Visually identify actions from the future.
- Jump to a corresponding state of a specific action.

![gmvxofxyqs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/21651926/44225044-d2b3-11e6-97ce-47e2e670cd9c.gif)

_[Source of the demo](https://github.com/chvin/react-tetris)_

### Reorder actions (https://github.com/alexkuz/redux-devtools-inspector/pull/64)

Just drag and drop specific actions. It will help to check weird race conditions as stated [here](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/761552171045359616) and also to better debug features.

![w8lxrddfsp 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/21652096/f5094dea-d2b3-11e6-8e74-899df8a0d1a4.gif)

_[Source of the demo](https://github.com/pl12133/react-solitaire)_

### Skip multiple actions at once (https://github.com/gaearon/redux-devtools-log-monitor/pull/47)

Hold `shift` key while toggling actions:

![esdgtjsq8g](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/21652547/b72caba0-d2b5-11e6-884c-ce80a86b967f.gif)

### Persist states right from the extension (#276)

By toggling the `Persist` button, the states won't be removed from the monitor on unloading the page and will be restored on reload:

![chaoxsnw6a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/21651825/d850b446-d2b2-11e6-943c-70dc98fad170.gif)

### Other fixes and improvements:
- Support for ES6 Symbols in action types (https://github.com/alexkuz/redux-devtools-inspector/pull/63).
- Improve styling (https://github.com/alexkuz/redux-devtools-inspector/pull/61).
- Better autoscroll behaviour (https://github.com/alexkuz/redux-devtools-inspector/pull/54).
- More detailed preview and diff for wide layout (https://github.com/alexkuz/redux-devtools-inspector/pull/51).
- Less verbose data in the Chart tooltip (https://github.com/romseguy/d3-state-visualizer/pull/8).
- Fix `disconnect` method (#272).
- Support for immutable data export/import (#278).

releases.name: Fixes and deprecations
releases.body:
### Deprecate undocumented `getMonitor` parameter

In `2.3` we've introduced a method to expose the monitors API ([see the release details](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/releases/tag/v2.3.0)). The purpose was to let users know when it is dispatched a monitor action or moving back and forth. So one can prevent side effects when time travelling or cancelling actions (see #86, #145, https://github.com/gaearon/redux-devtools/issues/167).

However, in `2.7` we added a better solution, to lock all the changes ([see the post](https://medium.com/@zalmoxis/improve-your-development-workflow-with-redux-devtools-extension-f0379227ff83) for details). So, we're deprecating `getMonitor` parameter, which is not necessary anymore. In case you still have a reason to use it, please open an issue.

### Fixes
- Fix Import / Export for non-redux apps.
- Don't send the state twice after importing.
- Fix styles in devpanel.

releases.name: Explore your data with Redux DevTools Extension
releases.body:
![o3wxqhqfbx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/20633136/fa084a62-b34b-11e6-9ceb-ae2e0e275c33.gif)

Chart and Inspector monitors are combined now. Just click on the node and get detailed tree view. Also now you can see states, actions and diffs as raw data, which can be expanded as a tree as well.

releases.name: Better serialization and filtering
releases.body:
- Serialiazation is now more performant and takes care of edge cases with circular references. Thanks to @kolodny for working on it!
- Time travelling now is aware of filtered actions and jumps over them.

releases.name: Better data flow
releases.body:
- Improve the data sending process.
- Autoselect the instance for the current window now when opening devpanel.
- Show all slider buttons when time travelling, but disabled when not available.
- Display errors from the client side during importing.

releases.name: Better export
releases.body: Now, instead of exporting all the states, only the list of actions and the preloaded state is exported. The resulted file is smaller and readable. Also [the serialized options ](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/releases/tag/v2.8.4) are applied (#255), so unserializable types (like dates, regexes, undefined, error objects, and functions) can be exported as well.

releases.name: v2.10.0
releases.body:
### Get remote reports right in the extension and import them right into your app

![koumdjxlux 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/19385477/57cb33fe-9217-11e6-89cf-95b1e434f998.gif)

Use [`redux-remotedev`](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-remotedev) with [`remotedev-server`](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remotedev-server) to save reports. To enable it, just click `Remote DevTools` button and add your host and port to the settings.

### Support monitor reducers

Now Redux Devtools monitors are compatible with the extension as their reducers are not ignored as before. The difference, however, is that the reducers are called not for every action, but only when a monitor action is dispatched.

releases.name: v2.9.0
releases.body:
Now Redux DevTools Extension is way more performant out of the box. Before highly updated apps would flood the extension causing it to take all the CPU.

[Here's an autotodo example](http://zalmoxisus.github.io/examples/router/) with lots of data and even containing circular references in the state. As you notice 100% of CPU is taken for rerendering React components while the extension takes only about 20%:

![fsunave82q](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/19889413/75976388-a03d-11e6-97cf-e7d77e937ba9.gif)

Also you can check [autoincremening example](http://zalmoxisus.github.io/examples/counter/) for a lighter demo.

While the extension is running in a separate process, 20% for a highly updated app shouldn't be a problem. If you want it to have no impact at all, **set the `latency` parameter to 1000 ms or more**, as you usually don't get to investigate more than one action per second. If the state is huge, you can either **set `maxAge` parameter to `30` or less** or **strip that payload by using `actionSanitizer` / `stateSanitizer` parameters**.

Example of usage:

``` js
const store = createStore(rootReducer, window.__REDUX_DEVTOOLS_EXTENSION__ && window.__REDUX_DEVTOOLS_EXTENSION__({
  latency: 1000,
  maxAge: 30,
  stateSanitizer: (state) => state.data ? { ...state, data: '<<LONG_BLOB>>' } : state
}));
```

If you still want all the changes to be available immediately, set `latency` parameter to `0`. Also the extension strips circular reference to gain the performance. If you want them to be serialized, **set `serializeAction` / `serializeState` to `false`**. If you want it in the fast mode keep them as `undefined` (which is by default).

releases.name: v2.8.5
releases.body:
### New script to include in other extensions

In case you're using Redux Extension inside other Chrome extensions, you should include `chrome-extension://lmhkpmbekcpmknklioeibfkpmmfibljd/js/redux-devtools-extension.js` script. Using of the old `inject.bundle.js` is deprecated. See [FAQ](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#how-to-include-it-in-chrome-apps-and-extensions) for more details. Big thanks to @jhen0409 for working on this!

### Support for ES6 SYMBOL in states or actions

In `v2.8.4` we introduced new `serializeState` and `serializeAction` parameters. Now if you set them to `true`, the extension will serialize the symbols value: `{ type: Symbol.for('DO_SOMETHING_ACTION') }` will become `{ type: "Symbol(DO_SOMETHING_ACTION)" }`.
See [the release notes](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/releases/tag/v2.8.4) for an example of usage and details.

### Log monitor's root objects are expanded now

Recently we collapsed action and state objects, however it's reverted now (#236).

releases.name: v2.8.4
v2.8.3
releases.body: ### New `predicate` parameter (#232) - **predicate** (_function_) - called for every action before sending, takes `state` and `action` object, and returns `true` in case it allows sending the current data to the monitor. Use it as a more advanced version of `actionsBlacklist`/`actionsWhitelist` parameters. Example of usage: ``` js const store = createStore(rootReducer, window.__REDUX_DEVTOOLS_EXTENSION__ && window.__REDUX_DEVTOOLS_EXTENSION__({ predicate: (state, action) => state.dev.logLevel === VERBOSE && !action.forwarded })); ``` ### Updated monitors - States and actions objects are collapsed from now: - Diff in the Inspector monitor show a preview before expanding it: ### Deprecations - Renamed `statesFilter` and `actionsFilter` to `stateSanitizer` and `actionSanitizer`.

releases.name: v2.8.2
releases.body:
### Keyboard shortcuts
- Added a new keyboard shortcut, `Cmd` (`Ctrl`) + `Shift` + `E`, which opens the extension's dialog (only when the Redux store is available in the current page).
- All other shortcuts used before (for opening windows and for Romote DevTools) are disabled by default. To set/change the keyboard shortcuts, click "Keyboard shortcuts" button on the bottom of the extensions page (`chrome://extensions/`).

### Iframes support

If the app is interacting with the extension from iframes, there will be 3 seconds delay for initialization, in order to avoid performance issues reported in https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/issues/207#issuecomment-254525267.

releases.name: v2.8.1
releases.body:
### Print the graph view of the app state or the changes log

![o98dry40pj](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/19320414/d76c18b2-90b9-11e6-88db-680ff85448f1.gif)

See https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remotedev-app/pull/22 for details.

### Fixes
- Better handling of circular references.
- Support actions with undefined states (https://github.com/gaearon/redux-devtools/issues/320).

releases.name: v2.8.0
releases.body:
### Better time travelling with changes right in the Graph Monitor

![ilzzlh1ild](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/19385321/8fa98cc2-9216-11e6-8c03-a6f20eb3e8b2.gif)

Now Graph Monitor:
- shows the current state when time travelling (#224)
- flashes the updated nodes to see which of them was changed (#180).

Slider Monitor is now:
- accessible: control with the keyboard.
- optimized: it's not rerendering, unless you're time travelling or selected Chart Monitor.
- informative: when Chart Monitor is selected, it will show the current action type there in addition to the state in the graph.

### Test generation
- Simplified tests generating. Mostly reverted what [`v2.5.0`](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/releases/tag/v2.5.0) was introducing, so it's more stable now and templates are simpler.
- Added Jest template.

### Other improvements
- Circular references inside states and action's payloads are stripped now, in order to make monitoring faster and stable.
- Warn about not allowing access to file URLs (#219).
- Don't update the store when the page is blacklisted in settings.

releases.name: v2.7.0
v2.6.1
releases.body:
### Fixes
- Added support for monitoring iframes from devpanel (#209).
- Fix passing `name` parameter (#212).
- Fix monitoring from devpanel after the tab is reloaded (#212).
- Fix removing the instance from devpanel.

releases.name: v2.6.0
releases.body:
### Refactored the whole functionality (#211)

Now the extension's functionality is handled by reducers and middlewares, which makes it more reliable and easer to debug. It's even possible to debug Redux DevTools Extension with Redux DevTools Extension:

![syefprikca](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/18550895/c78d9846-7b5e-11e6-9380-8395c770aa1b.gif)

It's necessary to blacklist `devTools/UPDATE_STATE` to avoid the infinite loop, and to require `src/browser/extension/inject`. However, most of the functionality was split into [`remotedev-app`](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remotedev-app), which can be debugged as a simple web application.

### Fixes and improvements
- All the features from the extension window are now available from Chrome DevTools Panel as well (#201)
- Removed batching actions, which wasn't effective enough (#208)

releases.name: v2.5.1
releases.body:
### Receive logs / reports from users and get them replicated right in the extension

See https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remotedev-server/pull/20 for usage details.

![cqjkercxyakhxpi](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/17812334/4bb87b94-662f-11e6-9e31-3e7fe051b8a8.jpg)

releases.name: v2.5.0
v2.4.0
releases.body:
#### 1. Use action creators for Dispatcher ([see examples](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/commit/477e69d8649dfcdc9bf84dd45605dab7d9775c03)):

![vzq00o0buq](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/17291006/114e7da8-57ea-11e6-99a9-050cca68e95b.gif)

#### 2. New design for Options page (thanks to @iamakulov):

![cncsc8sweaeio52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/17291076/7b986386-57ea-11e6-8f7d-3ca82189c5b0.jpg)![cncsft8waaahqme](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/17291163/e7456d2c-57ea-11e6-9060-da468760a42a.jpg)

#### 3. Optimized devtools panel [#170].

#### 4. Better support for non-redux apps (see [`mobx-remotedev`](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/mobx-remotedev)).

releases.name: v2.3.1
releases.body: #### Firefox support We're supporting firefox with all the features except running from Firefox DevTools panel (which will come as soon as it [will be implemented](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1211859)). Minimal required version is Firefox 48, which should be released soon. For now use Firefox Nightly or Developer Edition. To build the extension run `npm i && npm run build:firefox` and [load the extension's folder](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Temporary_Installation_in_Firefox) `./build/firefox`. It will also should be available on [AMO](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/remotedev/) soon.

releases.name: v2.3.0
v2.2.1
releases.body:
### Internal fixes
- Better approach for Electron DevTools extension (#152)
- Fix context menu listener when event page becomes inactive (#154)
- Added tests for enhancer, monitoring, React component (monitor), Chrome and Electron extension.

releases.name: v2.2.0
releases.body:
Generate tests with your templates as [presenting at React Europe](https://youtu.be/cbXLohVbzNI?t=392).
![rxe4bh9oco](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/16364526/ede60822-3bf1-11e6-94d2-c004cd7b7b1a.gif)

Also you can use it as stand alone component for Redux DevTools: https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-test-generator

releases.name: v2.1.0
releases.body:
### Support Electron DevTools extension

![2016-06-21 9 00 17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3001525/16214808/a53ca016-378e-11e6-97ce-3109b308aa1b.png)
Thanks to @jhen0409 and @LestaD for implementing this! You can use it with [`electron-devtools-installer`](https://github.com/GPMDP/electron-devtools-installer) along with React Devtools and other extensions. The only issue is that [`Import` button doesn't work](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/6156).

### Updated API

[`window.devToolsExtension.updateStore`](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/blob/master/docs/API/Methods.md#windowdevtoolsextensionupdatestorestore-instanceid) now have optional `instanceId` parameter required when having multiple instances (stores) in one tab.

### Fixes
- Fixed support for multiple instances (stores) in one tab.
- Include stack trace when throwing an exception in Chrome Devtools panel.

releases.name: v2.0.1
v2.0.0
releases.body:
## Support multiple Redux stores in one tab

To identify stores you can pass the `instanceId` parameter to the enhancer: `window.devToolsExtension({ name: 'Widget', instanceId: 'widgetId' })`.
It's not required. If this parameter is not specified, there will be generated a random id.

## Create Redux store right in the extension

> Note: This is not intended to replace Redux' createStore. Use this approach only when you want to inspect changes outside of Redux or when not using Redux inside your application.

Used as `window.devToolsExtension(reducer, [preloadedState, config])`.

See [API](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/blob/master/docs/API/Arguments.md#windowdevtoolsextensionreducer-preloadedstate-config) and [the example of usage](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/commit/1810d2c1f0e8be1daf8f2d8f7bbeb4f8c528d90b).

## Communicate with the extension directly

Use the following methods of `window.devToolsExtension`:
- [open](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/docs/API/Methods.md#windowdevtoolsextensionopenposition)
- [notifyErrors](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/docs/API/Methods.md#windowdevtoolsextensionnotifyerrorsonerror)
- [send](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/docs/API/Methods.md#windowdevtoolsextensionlistenonmessage-instanceid)
- [connect](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/docs/API/Methods.md#windowdevtoolsextensionconnectconfig)
- [disconnect](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/docs/API/Methods.md#windowdevtoolsextensiondisconnect)

See [a simple example](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/blob/master/examples/react-counter-messaging/components/Counter.js) of using `window.devToolsExtension.connect` to send changes to the extension directly without using Redux. Also, [here is more complex example](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/issues/77#issuecomment-222915421) of using the extension for `@ngrx/store`.

releases.name: v1.4.0
v1.3.1
releases.body:
### Memory usage optimization

Now when the extension is not used (extension's windows and app's tabs are closed), it becomes inactive and not occupy any memory.

### Fixes
- Fixed a memory leak due to subscribing to the background's redux store.
- Fix importing state from devpanel.
- Persist `remotedev-app` options.

releases.name: v1.3.0
releases.body: ### Switch monitors Now monitors are selected directly in the monitor window, Chrome devtools panel or browser action popup. Options page becomes simple again. Slide monitor can be included in any window by toggling the corresponding button. Diff monitor is removed as discussed in #97. Monitors are moved to `remotedev-app`, as it's just a simple web app, it's easier to add and test custom monitors. It's just [one file](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remotedev-app/blob/master/src/app/containers/DevTools.js) to be changed. ### Import / Export Fixed importing from a file. Added support for immutable structures. Example of usage with `immutable-js`: ``` js const store = createStore(rootReducer, window.devToolsExtension && window.devToolsExtension({ deserializeState: (state) => ({ todos: { ...state.todos, todoList: Immutable.fromJS(state.todos.todoList) } }) })); ``` ### Fixes and improvements - Fix missing messages after devtools panel is opened (#109). - Prevent applying listener multiple times (#112). - The code is not uglified anymore, so it's easier to deal with exceptions (#114).

releases.name: v1.2.0
releases.body:
- Monitors are moved into `remotedev-app`. As it is just a web application it's easier to add and test new custom monitors.
- Added [Dispatcher Monitor](https://github.com/YoruNoHikage/redux-devtools-dispatch), so you can dispatch your app's actions from the extension monitor. Just click the 'Dispatcher` button to open it.
- Updated Redux DevTools  to add support for observables (https://github.com/gaearon/redux-devtools/pull/275).

### BREAKING CHANGE

No unlimited actions history limit supported anymore (#108)

releases.name: v1.1.1
releases.body: Fix dispatching actions from chrome devtools according to new API of `remotedev-app`.

releases.name: v1.1.0
releases.body:
**Now you can import/export state history from a file**

![import-export](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/14762423/7bd47ea4-0982-11e6-81de-7f516228f841.jpg)

Fixes:
- Fix counting for isExcess (maxAge).
- Fix breaking changes from `remotedev-app`.
- Fix sync options when the extension is not ready yet.
- Add the icon to the devtools panel in order to support vendor themes.
- Improved styling.

releases.name: v1.0.1
releases.body: - Fix the issue of inspector monitor (not supporting blacklist/whitelist) (#25)

- The extension doesn't affect the performance anymore when no monitors are opened (#72).
- Support for multiple instances ([use `name` option](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension#api) to identify them) and monitors.
- Added remote monitoring, which communicate with [Remote Redux DevTools](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remote-redux-devtools) in order to support React Native, hybrid, desktop and server side apps. Also it is rather useful when using WebWorkers in your app.
- Works when the store is created twice (#93).
- Support persisting immutable.js states (#53).
- Added actionsBlacklist and actionsWhitelist config options (#79).
- Support logMonitor's reducers (#87).
- Always limit stored actions from now.

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta18
releases.body:
_This should be the last beta before 1.0 release._
- Support logMonitor's reducer.
- Use `maxAge` option instead of auto committing.
- Filter actions without using `filter-monitor`.
- Fix error notifications.
- Fix the option page layout on Windows.

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta17
releases.body: - Add actionsBlacklist and actionsWhitelist config options (#79)

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta16
releases.body:
- Disable deep serialization for now.
- Send new options to all instances not to only the current one.
- Fix inspecting another chrome extension.

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta14
releases.body: The extension doesn't affect the performance anymore when no monitors are opened (#72).

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta8
releases.body:
- Support non-JSON values (#60)
- Support persisting immutable.js states (#53)
- Added `redux-devtools-inspector` monitor (#64)

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta6
releases.body:
- Allow DevTools to access the frames (#56).
- Several fixes in `remotedev-app` and `slider-monitor`.

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta5
releases.body:
- Add regex support for the actions filtering (#45).
- Bring back the ability to [open a chrome panel](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension#how-to-keep-devtools-window-focused-all-the-time-in-a-chrome-panel) (#52).
- Don't check urls if we didn't get them from chrome storage (#49).

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta4
releases.body:
- Update monitors on hot-reloading.
- Fix reconnecting issue in `remotedev-app`.

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta3
releases.body:
- Added more descriptive errors in `Redux DevTools`.
- Fixed partial history in `remotedev-app` for remote monitoring.

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta2
releases.body:
Added remote monitoring, which communicate with [Remote Redux DevTools](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remote-redux-devtools) in order to support React Native, hybrid, desktop and server side apps. Also it is rather useful when using WebWorkers in your app. It is the same as in [`remotedev-app`](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remotedev-app), added here as a convenience not to install two apps.
![demo](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/remote-redux-devtools/raw/master/demo.gif)

releases.name: v1.0.0-beta1
releases.body:
- Now it's possible to have multiple monitors at once (on left, right and bottom).
- Use different monitors. Added:
  - [redux-slider-monitor](https://github.com/calesce/redux-slider-monitor)
  - [redux-devtools-diff-monitor](https://github.com/whetstone/redux-devtools-diff-monitor)
  - [redux-devtools-chart-monitor](https://github.com/romseguy/redux-devtools-chart-monitor).
- Support for multiple instances / tabs. Before we were detecting when the tab is reactivated, and relayed the whole history tree. It worked pretty well, except the cases when the app has background actions.
- Added buttons for opening options and monitor windows.
- Lots of fixes and enhances.

![Demo](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/raw/master/demo/v1.0.0.png)

releases.name: v0.4.11
releases.body:
The extension works way faster now!
- Now it relays actions and the current state instead of the whole lifted store state (history tree).
- There's no `delay` (timeout) option anymore.
- The `serialize` option is back (required for ImmutableJS states).
- The monitor is used only in the extension not in the injected page (in the user's app).
- Better error catching (prevent flooding).

releases.name: v0.4.10
releases.body:
Bug fixes release.
- Remove unsupported parameter in latest Canary.
- Serialize the payload everytime after it failed to be sent unserialized.
-   Serialize the current state of background store when initializing the devpanel.
- Add an example with Redux Router, where we generate consecutive actions ("AutoTodo") in order to simulate high activity.

releases.name: v0.4.9
releases.body:
![errdemo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7957859/11872965/d3d547b6-a4e0-11e5-82e2-35c49f801da6.gif)
- Show when errors occur in the app (not only reducer specific). Even in non-redux apps (by calling `window.devToolsExtension.notifyErrors()` explicitly).
- Attempt to fix issues with circular references.
- Nuke `serialize` option. Now the extension decides itself when the serialization is required.

releases.name: v0.4.8
releases.body:
- Notify when errors occur in the app (show a clickable Chrome notification and make the page action's icon red).
- Don't use React context.
- Use Redux Devtools 3.0.0 and [Redux DevTools Log Monitor Filterable](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-log-monitor-filterable).
- Updated to Babel 6.

releases.name: v0.4.7
releases.body:
Bug fixes release.
- Fix missing page action (popup icon) on page reload (#25).
- Add other shortcuts for OSX to fix conflicts with the default behaviour (#24).
- Show current shortcuts in the context menu.

releases.name: v0.4.6
releases.body:
- Open DevTools window to left, right, bottom or as a chrome panel.
- Choose window position from context menu.
- Add shortcuts:  Alt + Shift + Arrow left / right / bottom to show the window in the corresponding position or arrow up to open DevTools in Chrome panel.

releases.name: v0.4.5
releases.body:
- **Filter actions**. On the options page you may enable actions filtering and specify either actions to be hidden or shown in DevTools. If the latter is specified, other than those actions will be hidden.
- Update options without reloading the inspected page.
- Fix reopening DevTools window.
- Move devToolsInit from global variables.
- Prevent double options requesting when injecting in Chrome extensions.

releases.name: v0.4.4
releases.body:
- Page script loading is way faster, so there won't be cases when the extension's script is injected after the store is created.
- Better options processing (get them from the background page instead of reading storage every time).
- Add the ability to open DevTools in a chrome panel.
- Focus DevTools window instead of reopening it.
- Prevent injecting script in new empty Chrome tabs.
- Fix losing source maps from DevTools.

releases.name: v0.4.3
releases.body:
- Fixed persistState session id [#18]
- Increased popup (action page) width [#17]
- Removed `redux-devtools-dock-monitor`.

releases.name: v0.4.2
releases.body:
- DevTools' window now can be opened programmatically with `window.devToolsExtension.open()`.
- Fixed issue with loosing context menu.

releases.name: v0.4.1
releases.body:
- [Fix serialization](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/commit/9ba546d486449a2e153975104cc1a3c8b91d1430) (the init action was dispatched before we get options).
- [Implement options configuration for Chrome apps and extensions](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/commit/af59fe858c9e1b5b99930b20c8b1f9665d9419f2).

releases.name: v0.4.0
releases.body:
The extension is now configurable:
- **Maximum actions**: limit the quantity of stored actions, autocommit when exceeds, 0 - no limit.
- **Maximum delay**: set maximum delay to 0 in order to have no delay or set to a higher value if your app generates a lot of actions.
- **States serialization**: disable serialization if your states are plain objects with no circular references.
- **Inject in all pages**: disable to allow only the urls bellow.
- **Pages urls to inject DevTools in** (regex from new line).

releases.name: v0.3.1
releases.body:
- Do not parse messages from other scripts.
- Fix devtools source for the extensions background page.
- Simplify messaging with [crossmessaging](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/crossmessaging).

releases.name: v0.3.0
releases.body:
#### Breaking changes

Use 'window.devToolsExtension()' instead of 'window.devToolsExtension' as store enhancer. The latter is deprecated, and will be removed in 0.4.

#### Support for chrome apps and extensions

Added support for external messaging, so it is possible to use devtools for any chrome-based application.

Unlike web apps, Chrome extension doesn't inject anything in other chrome extensions or in chrome apps, so you have to do it by yourself to allow debugging. Just add:

```
<script src="chrome-extension://lmhkpmbekcpmknklioeibfkpmmfibljd/js/inject.bundle.js"></script>
```

releases.name: v0.2.1
releases.body:
Bug fixes release.
- Do not loose state linking when load another page in the same tab.
- Alert in devpanel when the store isn't find in the page.
- Show devtools for the current tab.

releases.name: v0.2.0
releases.body:
- Added support for Redux DevTools' persist state. Just add `?debug_session=<session_name>` to the url.
- Added support for Freezer. Just use [supportChromeExtension](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/freezer-redux-devtools#using-redux-devtools-chrome-extension) from `freezer-redux-devtools/freezer-redux-middleware`.
- Fixed bugs with messaging.

![Demo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/master/demo/v0.2.0.gif)

releases.name: v0.1.0
releases.body:
- Use `pageAction` instead of `browserAction`.
- Show popup icon and context menu only when theres a redux script in the tab.
- Support the store with circular references.
- Now available in [Chrome WebStore](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/redux-devtools/lmhkpmbekcpmknklioeibfkpmmfibljd).

![Demo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/master/demo/v0.1.0.gif)

releases.name: v0.0.1
releases.body:
Initial public release.
![Demo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/master/demo/v0.0.1.gif)
